intro: Pouteria brownlessiana, commonly known as the pink-fruit tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves and produces small, pinkish flowers that develop into edible, fleshy fruits. The fruits are typically consumed fresh or used in local cuisines. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
